Speed and hit %?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Speed and hit %?
By CRAZY CRAZY MATIZMO on Monday, July 15, 2002 - 06:39 pm:

does anyone know if speed really does rais hit % ?
it says so in the manual so i think it might be true but i havent proven it yet. and did anyone ever notice those little bars next to the guts usage numbers stats in battle? ther'ye how accurate the move wll be. . . i think

By Shin Kuwabara on Monday, July 15, 2002 - 07:17 pm:

Yes, I use the bars to determine hit accuracy. When you fight a hare with fast footwork only about two bars are filled. I think speed determines how fast these bars charge up. I have a Fantuger(Pixie/???) named Sakura with a Speed of 994 and she hits a lot. Her bars are almost always filled.

By CRAZY CRAZY MATIZMO on Tuesday, July 16, 2002 - 07:51 am:

ahhh thank you

By lakai on Tuesday, July 16, 2002 - 09:10 am:

Well my durahan/morx had like 90 speed and most of the time his attacks were 3 bars (unless against hares/hengars there just one: THunder Wind)

By Shin Kuwabara on Tuesday, July 16, 2002 - 04:37 pm:

Well, there are some exceptions. What were your Durahan's characteristics? Did it have Radar? You can view the Accuracy of an attack from the data screen. It usually improves when you level up skills. Were your skill levels high?

By The D on Tuesday, July 16, 2002 - 09:55 pm:

Even raising Skill Levels does not always improve the hit %. Only some skills actually raise the hit % and the ones that don't, they raise the power of the tech but not the hit %. Maybe SPD might differ the hit % a bit, but the big thing is the actual hit % of that attack.
